com.artisan.incodeapi
Class ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager

java.lang.Object
  com.artisan.incodeapi.ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager

public class ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager
extends java.lang.Object

Manages a purchase workflow with Artisan. This includes recording Artisan analytics events for:

- when items are viewed by the customer
- when items are added or removed from the customer's cart.
- when the cart is abandoned (user left the app without checking out)
- when the customer checks out successfully or unsuccessfully
- when the customer cancels checkout

These analytics events are automatically synced with Artisan and can be used for Advanced segmentation and personalization with the Artisan analytics reports, experiments, power hooks and campaigns.

          Call this method to remove an item from the Artisan cart model for the current purchase workflow.

It will remove the first item in the cart that matches the productIdentifier, price, description and quantity.

productViewed

public static void productViewed(java.lang.String productIdentifier,
                                 java.lang.Number price,
                                 java.lang.String description,
                                 java.lang.String category,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> productInfo)
Record an analytics event for a customer viewing a product. Uses the Currency.getInstance(Locale.getDefault()) by default for the priceLocale. 
 Map<String, String> productInfo = new HashMap<String, String>();
 productInfo.put("style", "organic cotton");
 productInfo.put("size", "medium");
 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.productViewed("ABC0000001", 24.99f, "Artisan T-Shirt made in Old City, Philadelphia", "T-Shirts", productInfo);

Parameters:
productIdentifier - An identifier for the product.
price - The price of the item.
description - A description of the product.
category - The category that you would like to record for this product.
productInfo - (optional, may be null) a dictionary of any key/value pairs of information about this product. This data will be attached to the analytics event in Artisan.

addItemToCart

public static void addItemToCart(java.lang.String productIdentifier,
                                 java.lang.Number price,
                                 java.lang.String description,
                                 java.lang.String category,
                                 int quantity,
                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> productInfo)
Add an item to the cart for the current purchase workflow. Uses the Locale.getDefault() by default for the currency. 
 Map<String, String> extraInfo = new HashMap<String, String>();
 extraInfo.put("style", "organic cotton");
 extraInfo.put("size", "medium");
 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.addItemToCart("ABC0000001", 24.99f, "Artisan T-Shirt made in Old City, Philadelphia", "T-Shirts", 1, extraInfo);

Parameters:
productIdentifier - An identifier for the product.
price - The price of the item. This should be the price of a single item.
description - A description of the product.
category - The category that you would like to record for this product.
quantity - The quantity of the product.
productInfo - (optional, may be null) a dictionary of any key/value pairs of information about this product. This data will be attached to the analytics event in Artisan.

removeItemFromCart

public static void removeItemFromCart(java.lang.String productIdentifier,
                                      java.lang.Number price,
                                      java.lang.String description,
                                      java.lang.String category,
                                      int quantity)
Call this method to remove an item from the Artisan cart model for the current purchase workflow.

It will remove the first item in the cart that matches the productIdentifier, price, description and quantity.

 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.removeItemFromCart("ABC0000001", 24.99f, "Artisan T-Shirt made in Old City, Philadelphia", "T-Shirts", 1);

Parameters:
productIdentifier - The identifier of the cart item that should be removed
price - The price of the cart item that should be removed
description - The description of the cart item that should be removed
category - The category of the cart item that should be removed
quantity - The quantity of the cart item that should be removed

emptyCart

public static void emptyCart()
Remove all items from the cart without marking it as abandoned or checked out.

Usage Example

 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.emptyCart();

cartIsEmpty

public static boolean cartIsEmpty()
Check if there are items in the cart model for this Artisan Purchase Workflow.

Returns:
true if there are any items in the cart model.

cartWasAbandoned

public static void cartWasAbandoned()
Record that the cart was abandoned.

The items will remain in the cart so that another purchase can be completed. If you want to empty the cart you should use ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager#emptyCart()

Usage Example:

 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.cartWasAbandoned();

cartCheckoutWasCancelled

public static void cartCheckoutWasCancelled()
Record that the checkout was cancelled by the customer.

The items will remain in the cart so that another purchase can be completed. If you want to empty the cart you should use ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager#emptyCart()

Usage Example:

 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.cartCheckoutWasCancelled();

cartCheckoutFailed

public static void cartCheckoutFailed()
Record that the checkout failed.

The items will remain in the cart so that another purchase can be completed. If you want to empty the cart you should use ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager#emptyCart()

Usage Example:

 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.cartCheckoutFailed();

cartCheckoutSucceededWithShippingAndTax

public static void cartCheckoutSucceededWithShippingAndTax(java.lang.Number shipping,
                                                           java.lang.Number tax)
Record that the cart was checked out successfully. We will record an analytics event including information on all of the products that were purchased.

We will automatically calculate the cart total and send that with the Artisan analytics event. It is assumed that all items in the cart will have the same currency; we will use the currency of the first item.

You may add shipping and tax information here and they will be recorded in the cart total. The amounts are assumed to be in the same currency as the items in the cart.

The cart will be emptied and reset after this.
Usage Example:
 ArtisanPurchaseWorkflowManager.cartCheckoutSucceededWithShippingAndTax(2.25f, 3.00f);

Parameters:
shipping - Amount of shipping to add to the cart total to make the transaction total. The amount is assumed to be in the same currency as the items in the cart.
tax - Amount of tax to add to the cart total to make the transaction total. The amount is assumed to be in the same currency as the items in the cart.
